resolution_description: 'Scallops' could revolutionize sustainable scallop harvesting in Saint-Brieuc Bay by developing a bio-engineered scallop breed with built-in bioluminescent markers that signal optimal harvest times, drastically reducing overfishing and enhancing population recovery without disrupting the ecosystem.

required_participants.reasoning: Recruiting the three researchers is crucial as they will have the expertise needed to develop the bio-engineered scallop breed and ensure the scientific validity of the project. Their knowledge will be essential for the successful implementation of the bioluminescent markers.

Engaging with the fishermen is important to ensure their cooperation and support for the new harvesting methods. They can provide practical insights into current harvesting practices and help facilitate a smooth transition to the new sustainable methods.

The population of sea scallops is a fundamental participant as the resolution directly impacts their survival and recovery. Understanding their current status and dynamics will be essential for assessing the effectiveness of the proposed bio-engineering solution.

resolution_description: Translation could revolutionize sustainable scallop harvesting in Saint-Brieuc Bay by developing an AI-powered linguistic interface that deciphers and communicates environmental signals and scallop behavioral patterns to fishermen in real-time, optimizing harvesting practices and ensuring ecological balance.
